e652e6fb418265340bb9704e5ad9c33173de6ed6efc95114112915a8675ae9a3","urls":["bzzr://d537e87dd6bc47263da27a6a4e97fcebfc31bb5aa2e3a3d5082e3ef787a0e591"]}},"version":1}

nodes.documentation:
@dev We consider every contract to be a 'token holder' since it's currently not possible
for a contract to deny receiving tokens.

The TokenHolder's contract sole purpose is to provide a safety mechanism that allows
the owner to send tokens that were sent to the contract by mistake back to their sender.

Note that we use the non standard ERC-20 interface which has no return value for transfer
in order to support both non standard as well as standard token contracts.
see https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/4116
nodes.name: TokenHolder
withdrawTokens

for a contract to deny receiving tokens.

The TokenHolder's contract sole purpose is to provide a safety mechanism that allows
the owner to send tokens that were sent to the contract by mistake back to their sender.

Note that we use the non standard ERC-20 interface which has no return value for transfer
in order to support both non standard as well as standard token contracts.

nodes.name: TokenHolder
withdrawTokens

acceptOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer

transferOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the contract ownership the new owner still needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner

withdrawTokens(address,address,uint256).details: withdraws tokens held by the contract and sends them to an account can only be called by the owner

params._to: account to receive the new amount
